subject: Science
title: Exothermic vs. Endothermic
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Exothermic vs. Endothermic.

hook.text: Some reactions release heat. Others absorb it. The difference powers engines and cools your drink.

buildup.text: Exothermic reactions release energy ‚Äî burning fuel, rusting iron, setting off fireworks.

discovery.text: Endothermic reactions absorb energy ‚Äî like melting ice or photosynthesis in plants.

twist.text: Instant cold packs work because a chemical inside absorbs heat when dissolved in water.

climax.text: Whether a reaction is exo- or endothermic depends on the energy stored in chemical bonds.

punchline.text: Breaking bonds costs energy. Making bonds releases it. The balance decides hot or cold.

quiz.question: What makes a reaction exothermic?
options: It releases more energy than it absorbs
It absorbs energy from the surroundings
It requires a catalyst to proceed
